tool.name: FPStep3
tool.description: Per-sample metagenome functional profiles based on the predicted functions for each study sequence.

param.name: function
param.label: Function file
param.help: Copy number table of gene families/functions present in the predicted genome for each OTU (output of FPStep2 : FPStep2_predicted_functions.tsv).

param.name: marker
param.label: Marker file
param.help: Table of predicted marker copy number (output of FPStep2 : FPStep2_marker_copy_number.tsv).

param.name: max_nsti
param.label: NSTI cut-off
param.help: Sequences with NSTI values above this value will be excluded (default: 2)

param.name: min_reads
param.label: Minimum number of reads accross all samples
param.help: Minimum number of reads across all samples for each input OTU. OTUs below this cut-off will be counted as part of the "RARE" category in the stratified output but not removed from the analysis (default: 1).

param.name: min_samples
param.label: Minimum number of samples to keep an OTU.
param.help: Minimum number of samples that an OTU needs to be identified within. OTUs below this cut-off will be counted as part of the "RARE" category in the stratified output but not removed from the analysis (default: 1).

param.name: strat
param.label: Do you want also a table stratified per sequences ?
param.help: Also product the predicted genes abundances contributed by each individual sequence. This is in contrast to the default stratified output, which is the contribution to the community-wide gene abundances. Note this will greatly increase the runtime.

param.name: hierarchy_ranks
param.help: The ordered genes ranks levels stored in BIOM. Each rank is separated by one space.

tool.help:
@HELP_LOGO@
.. class:: infomark page-header h2
What it does
Prediction of functional abundances based solely on the sequences of marker genes with `PICRUSt2 <https://github.com/picrust/picrust2>`_.
.. class:: infomark page-header h2
Context
Firstly, the input sequence abundance table (function file output of FPStep2) is normalized by the predicted number of marker genes (marker file). It will then determine the predicted functional profiles per sample. The normalized sequence abundance table and the weighted nearest-sequenced taxon index values per-sample will also be output.
.. class:: infomark page-header h2
Inputs/Outputs
.. class:: h3
Inputs
**Biom file**:
The OTUs biom file used in FPStep1. (format `biom1 <http://biom-format.org/documentation/format_versions/biom-1.0.html>`_).
**Function file**:
The table of predicted marker gene copy numbers per study sequence in input tree. (FPStep2_predicted_functions.tsv)
**Marker file**:
The table with predicted abundances per study sequence in input tree. (FPStep2: marker_nsti_predicted.tsv)
**NSTI cut-off**:
Nearest Sequenced Taxon Index (NSTI) is the sum of phylogenetic distances for each organism in the OTU table to its nearest sequenced reference genome, measured in terms of substitutions per site in the 16S rRNA gene and weighted by the frequency of that organism in the OTU table. This metric can be used to identify study sequences that are highly distant from all reference sequences (the predictions for these sequences are less reliable!). By default the maximum NSTI cut-off for subsequent commands is 2. Any study sequences with a NSTI value higher than 2 are typically either from uncharacterized phyla or off-target sequences.
.. class:: h3
Outputs
**Function abundance file**:
Output file for metagenome abundances predictions of gene families per samples. (FPStep3_pred_metagenome_unstrat.tsv)
If stratified option is activate, the abundances predictions are done for each OTU, in order to see the contribution of each OTU within each sample. ( Warning, the file produced may be heavy. ) (FPStep3_pred_metagenome_contrib.tsv)
**Seqtab normalized file**:
Output file with abundance normalized. (FPStep3_seqtab_norm.tsv)
**Weighted nsti file**:
Output file with average nsti calculated per sample.
**Summary file**:
.. image:: static/images/FROGS_FPStep3_piecharts.png
OTUs are excluded if the NSTI associated is above the threshold selected.
.. image:: static/images/FROGS_FPStep3_sunburst.png
Gene families (in KEGG and Metacyc) are classified according to 3 hierarchy levels, the graph shows the proportion of each level according to the samples selected.
@HELP_CONTACT@
